intro: Horkelia gordonii var. megalopetala, commonly known as the large-petaled horkelia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its showy, violet-blue flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils in open habitats such as meadows and slopes. Its leaves are basal, linear, and often covered in fine hairs, while its stems are upright and branched. This variety is distinguished by its larger, more showy petals compared to other horkelia species.
